page.title: 15INTERVIEW WITH FISHERMAN
page.content: We interviewed a retired fisherman-Mr. Oliver,to ask him about Cullercoats and his lifestyle as a fisherman.Here is a summary of the interview. The working day of a fisherman varies depending on the aim of the catch.To haul crab pots you need to be up between 3:30 and 4:00 am and you finish at about 12:00 pm but in summer when the salmon season begins he could be out until as late as 7:00 pm.When not actually fishing his time is spent mending nets etc. When catching salmon a five inch mesh is used.The net is forty mesh deep and is drifted from East to West,and from North to South on a flood tide. The fish caught include white fish,lemon sole and salmon.Crabs are also caught.Today things that were once done by hand are now done by mechanical equipment.
